CIPHER.0.cipherString: Things may come to those who wait, but only the things left by those who hustle.
CIPHER.0.question: Solve this aristocrat.

CIPHER.1.cipherString: At every party there are two kinds of people - those who want to go home and those who don't. The trouble is, they are usually married to each other.
CIPHER.1.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(11,3).

CIPHER.2.cipherString: These days, all we hear about is that the industry is in trouble. Everybody is so scared, but our mission statement is having no fear.
CIPHER.2.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(23,17).

CIPHER.3.cipherString: You must learn to be still in the midst of activity and to be vibrantly alive in repose.
CIPHER.3.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(21,19).

CIPHER.4.cipherString: It is conceivable that what is unified form to the author or composer may of necessity be formless to his audience.
CIPHER.4.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(7,16).

CIPHER.5.cipherString: Sad people dislike the happy, and the happy the sad; the quick thinking the sedate, and the careless the busy and industrious.
CIPHER.5.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(3,13).

CIPHER.6.cipherString: I believe in aliens. I think it would be way too selfish of us as mankind to believe we are the only lifeforms in the universe.
CIPHER.6.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(17,15).

CIPHER.7.cipherString: To look forward and not back, To look out and not in, and To lend a hand.
CIPHER.7.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(3,19).

CIPHER.8.cipherString: Once a month, try something you don't think you'd be good at. You can find such happy surprises.
CIPHER.8.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(15,19).

CIPHER.9.cipherString: We're born with the desire, but we don't really know how to choose. We don't know what our taste is, and we don't know what we are seeing.
CIPHER.9.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(21,21).

CIPHER.10.cipherString: Everything in life has a price on it - there ain't a damn thing free in America, and football has got a price on it.
CIPHER.10.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. (a,b)=(9,10).
